title: On the construction of non-simple blow-up solutions for the singular Liouville equation with a potential
abstract: We are concerned with the existence of blowing-up solutions to the following boundary value problem $$-Δu= λV(x) e^u-4πN δ_0\;\mbox{ in } B_1,\quad u=0 \;\mbox{ on }\partial B_1,$$ where $B_1$ is the unit ball in $\mathbb R^2$ centered at the origin, $V(x)$ is a positive smooth potential, $N$ is a positive integer ($N\geq 1$). Here $δ_0$ defines the Dirac measure with pole at $0$, and $λ>0$ is a small parameter. We assume that $N=1$ and, under some suitable assumptions on the derivatives of the potential $V$ at $0$, we find a solution which exhibits a non-simple blow-up profile as $λ\to 0^+$.
comment: 23 pages. arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:2103.17025
